column1: Phayao (Thai pronunciation: [pʰā.jāw]) is a town (thesaban mueang) in northern Thailand
column2: capital of Phayao Province.  The town is divided into the sub-districts of Mae Tam and Wiang

column1: The town is on the shore of the Phayao Lake. It dates back to the semi-independent city-state (mueang)
column3: 000 years ago.As of 2005 Phayao had a population of 19
column4: 118. Phayao lies 726 km north of Bangkok.
